connector.description:
Send message to an Amazon Simple Notification Service (SNS) topic.

The basic authentication method for the SNS service is to specify an access key and a secret key. These parameters are optional because the Kamelet provides a default credentials provider.

If you use the default credentials provider, the SNS client loads the credentials through this provider and doesn't use the basic authentication method.

In the header, you can optionally set the `subject` / `ce-subject` property to specify the subject of the message.

camel.kamelet.aws-sns-sink.topicNameOrAr.name: camel.kamelet.aws-sns-sink.topicNameOrArn
camel.kamelet.aws-sns-sink.topicNameOrAr.description: The SNS topic name name or Amazon Resource Name (ARN).

camel.kamelet.aws-sns-sink.accessKey.name: camel.kamelet.aws-sns-sink.accessKey
camel.kamelet.aws-sns-sink.accessKey.description: The access key obtained from AWS.

camel.kamelet.aws-sns-sink.secretKey.name: camel.kamelet.aws-sns-sink.secretKey
camel.kamelet.aws-sns-sink.secretKey.description: The secret key obtained from AWS.

camel.kamelet.aws-sns-sink.autoCreateTop.name: camel.kamelet.aws-sns-sink.autoCreateTopic
camel.kamelet.aws-sns-sink.autoCreateTop.description: Setting the autocreation of the SNS topic.

camel.kamelet.aws-sns-sink.useDefaultCre.name: camel.kamelet.aws-sns-sink.useDefaultCredentialsProvider
camel.kamelet.aws-sns-sink.useDefaultCre.description: If true, the SNS client loads credentials through a default credentials provider. If false, it uses the basic authentication method (access key and secret key).

camel.kamelet.aws-sns-sink.useProfileCre.name: camel.kamelet.aws-sns-sink.useProfileCredentialsProvider
camel.kamelet.aws-sns-sink.useProfileCre.description: Set whether the SNS client should expect to load credentials through a profile credentials provider.

camel.kamelet.aws-sns-sink.useSessionCre.name: camel.kamelet.aws-sns-sink.useSessionCredentials
camel.kamelet.aws-sns-sink.useSessionCre.description: Set whether the SNS client should expect to use Session Credentials. This is useful in situation in which the user needs to assume a IAM role for doing operations in SNS.

camel.kamelet.aws-sns-sink.profileCreden.name: camel.kamelet.aws-sns-sink.profileCredentialsName
camel.kamelet.aws-sns-sink.profileCreden.description: If using a profile credentials provider this parameter will set the profile name.

camel.kamelet.aws-sns-sink.sessionToken.name: camel.kamelet.aws-sns-sink.sessionToken
camel.kamelet.aws-sns-sink.sessionToken.description: Amazon AWS Session Token used when the user needs to assume a IAM role.

camel.kamelet.aws-sns-sink.uriEndpointOv.name: camel.kamelet.aws-sns-sink.uriEndpointOverride
camel.kamelet.aws-sns-sink.uriEndpointOv.description: The overriding endpoint URI. To use this option, you must also select the `overrideEndpoint` option.

camel.kamelet.aws-sns-sink.overrideEndpo.name: camel.kamelet.aws-sns-sink.overrideEndpoint
camel.kamelet.aws-sns-sink.overrideEndpo.description: Select this option to override the endpoint URI. To use this option, you must also provide a URI for the `uriEndpointOverride` option.
